features¶

build_features.py¶

src.features.build_features.build_features(path: str, label: str)[source]¶

This function allows you to: - build the preprocessed dataframe - generate the MinMax scaler - generate a list of the features - generate a dictionary of mode for numerical values

Parameters

  • path (str) – path of the dataset to preprocessed

  • label (str) – label

Returns

the preprocessed dataframe

Return type

pd.DataFrame

Returns

the MinMax scaler

Return type

MinMaxScaler

Returns

a list of the features

Return type

list

Returns

dictionary of numerical columns and associated mode

Return type

src.features.build_features.do_min_max_scaler(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, numerical_columns)[source]¶
This function allows you to:

  • transform features by scaling each feature to a given range

  • store the scaler

Parameters

df – dataframe to scale

:type df:pd.DataFrame :param numerical_columns: list of numerical columns in the dataframe :type numerical_columns: list :return: modified dataframe :rtype: pd.DataFrame :return: scaler :rtype: MinMaxScaler

src.features.build_features.fix_anomalie_employment(value, mode)[source]¶

This function allows you to fix an anomalie by the mode

Parameters

  • value (str) – days of employment

  • mode (int) – mode

Returns

new value

Return type

int

src.features.build_features.generate_features(path: str, label: str)[source]¶

This function allows you to: - generate the preprocessed dataset - store metadata - store the new dataframe

Parameters

  • path (str) – path where you want to store the new dataset

  • label (str) – label

src.features.build_features.get_columns_with_type(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, type: str)[source]¶

This function allows you to get all the columns with a certain type

Parameters

df – dataframe you want to get all the columns with a certain type

:type df:pd.DataFrame :param type: the type you need :type type: str :return: dataframe with columns of this type :rtype: pd.DataFrame

src.features.build_features.get_dummies_categorical(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, categorical_cols)[source]¶

This function allows you to do one hot encoding on categorical columns

Parameters

df – dataframe you want to preprocessed

:type df:pd.DataFrame :param categorical_cols: dataframe with categorical columns :type categorical_cols: pd.DataFrame :return: dataframe preprocessed :rtype: pd.DataFrame

src.features.build_features.get_numerical_columns(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, label: str)[source]¶

This function allows you to get the number of numerical columns in the dataframe

Parameters

df (pd.DataFrame) – the dataframe we want to get the number of numerical columns

Returns

list of numerical columns

Return type

list

src.features.build_features.preprocess_numerical_features(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, numerical_columns, label: str)[source]¶

This function allows you to fill NULL/NA values with the mode

Parameters

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – the dataframe to preprocessed

  • numerical_columns (list) – list of numerical columns in the dataframe

  • label (str) – label

Returns

the modified dataframe

Return type

pd.DataFrame

Returns

dictionary of numerical columns and associated mode

Return type

src.features.build_features.remove_percent_missing_values(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, percent: int)[source]¶

This function allows you to do feature selection/reduction by deleting features with more than x% of NULL/NA values.

Parameters

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – dataframe to modify

  • percent (int) – a limit percentage to fix in order to remove features with more than this percentage of NULL/NA values

Returns

the modified dataframe

Return type

pd.DataFrame

src.features.build_features.transform_dob_catage(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, days_birth: str)[source]¶

This function allows you to transform days of birth from days to year to age class

Parameters

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – dataframe to modify

  • days_birth (str) – column with the days of birth

Returns

new classe_age column

Return type

pd.DataFrame
